title: Ring of visibility

properties.name: description
properties.value: The ring of visibility is a special ring that can be obtained from Rasolo the merchant, after the player retrieves his gilded cross for him during the quest Desert Treasure. Wearing the ring lets the player see mysterious ghosts and other objects that are normally invisible. The ring of visibility cannot be made using the Crafting skill.

Item ID4657

The ring of visibility is a special ring that can be obtained from Rasolo the merchant, after the player retrieves his gilded cross for him during the quest Desert Treasure. Wearing the ring lets the player see mysterious ghosts and other objects that are normally invisible. The ring of visibility cannot be made using the Crafting skill.

Whenever the player dies while wearing/having the ring of visibility in your inventory, the player will always lose it even if they had less than 3 items on them. The exception is if the player dies while fighting Damis during Desert Treasure, in which case the player will keep the ring like normal. If lost, the ring can be reclaimed from Rasolo, west of the Fishing Guild and south of the Baxtorian Falls.

 Attack bonuses
+0+0+0+0+0
 Defence bonuses
+0+0+0+0+0
 Other bonusesSlot
+0+0+0%+0List

Uses[edit | edit source]

  • Accessing the Shadow Dungeon during and after Desert Treasure
  • Seeing the mysterious ghosts for the Curse of the Empty Lord miniquest
  • Seeing General Khazard and his scouts as part of The General's Shadow
  • Seeing the Shaeded Beast in the Forthos Dungeon
  • Seeing the ghost on top of Mynydd
  • Seeing the Ancient Ghosts on the Isle of Souls
  • Seeing the ghosts in the Ruins of Camdozaal
  • In some Treasure Trails
  • Encountering Knight spirits in the Hallowed Sepulchre while looting chests
  • Starting Hopespear's Will after completion of Land of the Goblins

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The ring's appearance as a plain, golden ring may be a reference to the One Ring from J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit. The One Ring shares this appearance, as well as the ability to see things others cannot.

[[File:Ring of visibility detail.png|left|100px]]
The '''ring of visibility''' is a special ring that can be obtained from [[Rasolo]] the merchant, after the player retrieves his [[gilded cross]] for him during the quest [[Desert Treasure]]. Wearing the ring lets the player see [[mysterious ghost]]s and other objects that are normally invisible. The ring of visibility cannot be made using the [[Crafting]] skill.

Whenever the player dies while wearing/having the ring of visibility in your inventory, the player will always lose it even if they had less than 3 items on them. The exception is if the player dies while fighting Damis during Desert Treasure, in which case the player will keep the ring like normal. If lost, the ring can be reclaimed from [[Rasolo]], west of the [[Fishing Guild]] and south of the [[Baxtorian Falls]].

==Uses==
*Accessing the [[Shadow Dungeon]] during and after [[Desert Treasure]]
*Seeing the [[mysterious ghost]]s for the [[Curse of the Empty Lord]] [[miniquest]]
*Seeing [[General Khazard]] and his [[scout]]s as part of [[The General's Shadow]]
*Seeing the [[Shaeded Beast]] in the [[Forthos Dungeon]]
*Seeing the [[Ghost (Mynydd)|ghost]] on top of [[Mynydd]]
*Seeing the [[Ancient Ghost]]s on the [[Isle of Souls]]
*Seeing the [[Ghost_(Ruins_of_Camdozaal)|ghosts]] in the [[Ruins of Camdozaal]]
*In some [[Treasure Trails]]
*Encountering Knight spirits in the [[Hallowed Sepulchre]] while looting chests
*Starting [[Hopespear's Will]] after completion of [[Land of the Goblins]]

== Trivia ==

* The ring's appearance as a plain, golden ring may be a reference to the [[wikipedia:One_Ring|One Ring]] from [[wikipedia:J._R._R._Tolkien|J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s [[wikipedia:The_Lord_of_the_Rings|The Lord of the Rings]] and [[wikipedia:The_Hobbit|The Hobbit]]. The One Ring shares this appearance, as well as the ability to see things others cannot.
